purpleculture_pinyin:
hǔ
a tiger's roar; to scare
рык тигра; бояться
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 虎 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
唬弄 [ hǔ nòng ]: to fool; to deceive
唬烂 [ hǔ làn ]: (slang) (Tw) to bullshit; to fool

    • 虎 [ hǔ ] tiger; brave, fierce; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: If a tiger runs into a bigger animal like a rhino or elephant he'll open his mouth and show his teeth but his is really just scared and bluffing.

xià: (графема) пугать (вариант 吓)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If a tiger runs into a bigger animal like a rhino or elephant he'll open his mouth and show his teeth but his is really just scared and bluffing.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " mouth " to " tiger ", " tiger " is also a sound symbol, the word means tiger roar. " Suowen " is the original meaning of " bluff " with the sound of tiger . "Shuowen": "Hmm, huh. One is the tiger's voice. From the mouth to the tiger. Read Ruohao." Duan Yucai changed the "hip" to "the tiger's voice", and the note: "Popular Wen" says : The sound of the tiger is called roar." "Jiyun": "This is the number, call it." In the Warring States period, the " mouth " is often moved under the " tiger ", or the pen is placed next to the tiger. "Shuowen" uses the word " hu " and " kou " as the ancient prose with the word " abuse ", see " abuse ".

Jin Wentong is pronounced " Hu ", a preposition, and its usage is equivalent to " Yu ." Shanding: "Fu (only) use proper (sui) blessing (hu) former literati", which refers to those who have had cultural virtues in previous lives to get blessing. Cai Xie's sly sentence is similar to this, as "Yin Diao (uncle) uses proper (sui) to be more blessed to the Emperor Kao De Yin Ji Ji" (see Guo Moruo).

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period are also read as " Hu ". "Confucius Poetry Theory" Jane 1: "Those who do this do not (their) and (have) not the king (almost)?" The whole sentence refers to those who practice this philosophy, how can there be people who do not claim the king? "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 14 and Jane 8: "So Shun started to bluff (almost) the way of the people of Yao Tiandi", referring to that Shun then began to tell the people of Yao Tiandi.
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from " mouth " to " tiger ", " tiger " is also a sound symbol, the word means tiger roar.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「口」從「虎」，「虎」亦是聲符，字會虎吼叫之意。《說文》即以虎聲為「唬」的本義。《說文》：「唬，嗁聲也。一曰虎聲。从口从虎。讀若暠。」段玉裁改「嗁聲」為「虎聲」，注云：「《通俗文》曰：虎聲謂之哮。」《集韻》：「本作號，呼也。」戰國文字多將「口」移到「虎」下，或疊加飾筆於虎旁。《說文》以從「虎」從「口」的字為「虐」字古文，參見「虐」。

　　金文通讀為「乎」，介詞，用法相當於「于」，善鼎：「隹(唯)用妥(綏)福唬(乎)前文人」，指從前世有文德的人得到福澤。蔡姞簋句與此相類，作「尹弔(叔)用妥(綏)多福于皇考德尹叀姬」(參郭沫若)。

　　戰國竹簡亦通讀為「乎」，《上博竹書一．孔子詩論》簡1：「行此者丌(其)又(有)不王唬(乎)？」全句指實行這種理念的人，怎會有不稱王的呢？《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡14和簡8：「舜於是唬(乎)始語堯天地人民之道」，指舜於是開始告訴堯天地人民的道理。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「口」從「虎」，「虎」亦是聲符，字會虎吼叫之意。

金文從「 口 」從「 虎 」，「 虎 」亦是聲符，字會虎吼叫之意。《說文》即以虎聲為「 唬 」的本義。《說文》：「唬，嗁聲也。一曰虎聲。从口从虎。讀若暠。」段玉裁改「嗁聲」為「虎聲」，注云：「《通俗文》曰：虎聲謂之哮。」《集韻》：「本作號，呼也。」戰國文字多將「 口 」移到「 虎 」下，或疊加飾筆於虎旁。《說文》以從「 虎 」從「 口 」的字為「 虐 」字古文，參見「 虐 」。 金文通讀為「 乎 」，介詞，用法相當於「 于 」，善鼎：「隹(唯)用妥(綏)福唬(乎)前文人」，指從前世有文德的人得到福澤。蔡姞簋句與此相類，作「尹弔(叔)用妥(綏)多福于皇考德尹叀姬」(參郭沫若)。 戰國竹簡亦通讀為「 乎 」，《上博竹書一．孔子詩論》簡1：「行此者丌(其)又(有)不王唬(乎)？」全句指實行這種理念的人，怎會有不稱王的呢？《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡14和簡8：「舜於是唬(乎)始語堯天地人民之道」，指舜於是開始告訴堯天地人民的道理。

One is the tiger's voice. From the mouth to the tiger. Read Ruohao." Duan Yucai changed the "hip" to "the tiger's voice", and the note: "Popular Wen" says : The sound of the tiger is called roar." "Jiyun": "This is the number, call it." In the Warring States period, the " mouth" is often moved under the " tiger", or the pen is placed next to the tiger. "Shuowen" uses the word " hu" and " kou" as the ancient prose with the word " abuse", see " abuse". Jin Wentong is pronounced " Hu", a preposition, and its usage is equivalent to " Yu." Cai Xie's sly sentence is similar to this, as "Yin Diao (uncle) uses proper (sui) to be more blessed to the Emperor Kao De Yin Ji Ji" (see Guo Moruo). 唬字的基本解释

唬
hǔ
威吓（h?）：虚张声势是唬不住人的。
蒙混，蒙哄：用流言唬人。

唬
xià
同“吓1”。

唬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xià］
同“嚇2”。
(1)恐吓；使害怕。
(2)害怕；吃惊。
[②]［hǔ］
(1)虚张声势、夸大事实以蒙混人。
(2)见“唬2唬”。
[③]［háo］
［《集韻》乎刀切，平，匣。］
通“號2”。
呼号。
[④]［xiāo］
［《廣韻》呼訝切，去禡，曉。］
［《集韻》虚交切，平爻，曉。］
虎怒声。

唬字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　唬； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页193第12
【唐韻】呼訝切【集韻】虛訝切，?音嚇。【說文】嗁聲也。　又【說文】一曰虎聲也。　又【集韻】虛交切，音哮。義同。本作虓，亦作猇。　又【集韻】【類篇】?乎刀切，音豪。【集韻】本作號，呼也。或作臯號。　又【集韻】下老切，音皓。虎聲也。　又【廣韻】古伯切【集韻】郭獲切，?音虢。義同。　又【廣韻】鳥啼也。

[Chou Ji 1] [Words Department] 　唬; Kangxi strokes: 11; page number: page 193-12
[Tang Yun] Shocked and cut [Jiyun] Shocked and cut, sound scared. [Said the text] Humbling too.　[Said Wen] Said the tiger sound again.　 [Ji Yun] Virtual intersecting, screaming. The same meaning. This is for 虓, also for 猇.　[Jiyun] [Class Chapter]? Almost knife cut, Yinhao. [Jiyun] This is the number, call it. Or as Gao number.　[Ji Yun] Xia Lao Qie, Yin Hao. Tiger sounds too.　[Guang Yun] Gu Boqie [Ji Yun] Guo Huoqie,? Yin Guo. The same meaning.　[Guangyun] Birds cry also.

唬
会意字。从口、从虎,表示老虎的叫声。本义是虎吼叫或类似的声音。引申为吓唬、恐吓。
Ohi 虚张声势、夸大事实来威吓或蒙混人:~小孩。e
